where T 0 is the seabed temperature, G is the geothermal gradient, B is the burial rate and z is depth. A geothermal gradient of G = 30 °C km –1, burial rate of B = 10 –5 m yr –1 and seabed temperature of T 0 = 10 °C were used for all calculations (all notation given in Supplementary Table 2). This G value may underestimate the true value in the Vøring and Møre Basins
51 but may overestimate the true value in the Rockall Basin, where extreme crustal extension has occurred.
